title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: The detailed requirements for the CodePerformanceProfiler tool are gathered and documented. The scope includes supporting popular programming languages such as JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Ruby, PHP, Java, and others that are commonly used in web development. Performance metrics to analyze include execution time, memory usage, CPU utilization, network latency, I/O operations, and more. Optimization techniques to teach encompass algorithm optimization, code profiling, caching, data structure optimization, concurrency optimization, and more. The desired user experience involves a user-friendly interface, comprehensive reporting, integration with popular Integrated Development Environments (IDEs) like Visual Studio Code, IntelliJ IDEA, or Atom, and a feature for suggesting optimization techniques based on the code analysis results. Additionally, it is important to consider incorporating an advanced search functionality for code snippets and documentation. This RFC is approved and ready for the next state, task decomposition. Assigned to: task-decomposer.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Define the overall system architecture, including the components, data flow, and integration points required for the CodePerformanceProfiler tool.

title: Design User Interface
description: Create wireframes and mockups for the user interface, including the code submission process, performance analysis display, and optimization technique tutorials.

title: Set up Development Environment
description: Configure the development environment, including version control, continuous integration, and deployment pipelines.

title: Implement Code Analysis Engine
description: Develop the core engine that analyzes submitted code and identifies performance bottlenecks and optimization opportunities.

title: Implement User Interface
description: Develop the user interface components for code submission, performance analysis display, and optimization technique tutorials based on the approved designs.

title: Set up Database and Storage
description: Design and implement the database schema and storage solutions for storing and retrieving user-submitted code, performance analysis results, and optimization techniques.

title: Implement Security Measures
description: Implement security measures to protect user-submitted code and ensure the system is secure against potential threats and vulnerabilities.

title: Write Documentation and Tutorials
description: Create comprehensive documentation and tutorials for users, covering code submission, performance analysis interpretation, and optimization techniques.

title: Implement Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Define and implement a comprehensive testing strategy, including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests, to ensure the quality and reliability of the CodePerformanceProfiler tool.
